resources.name: Tracking
resources.description: Provides a Public API to ingest location updates for tracking of shipments or assets .

resources.name: Appointments
resources.description: Appointments API provides the capabilty to create and manage appointments in turvo appointment scheduling

resources.name: Read calendar configuration for whole day
Reservations
resources.description: Reservations API provides the capability to create and manage slots and reservations in turvo appointment scheduling

resources.name: Routing Guide
resources.description: RoutingGuides allow tendering shipments to carriers that have been pre-arranged to receive them based on set of rules defined.

resources.name: Exceptions
resources.description: Exceptions are used to communicate, track, and manage any unforeseen events that happen along a route that could affect the driver’s arrival time.

resources.name: VIN
resources.description: Vehicle Identification Number [(VIN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vehicle_identification_number) is a unique code used in the automotive industry to identify individual vehicles. Use this endpoint to retrieve detailed information of a vehicle, including make, model and dimensions.

resources.name: Tasks
resources.description: In Turvo, you can create a task and assign it to a Turvo user. Through the API, you can create new tasks and assign it to a user, as well as edit and view existing tasks.

resources.name: Tags
resources.description: Tags are identifiable entities used across other Turvo objects that allow for quick retrieval of objects, classification, or workflow management. Tags can be created and attached to specific entities through the API.

resources.name: Documents
resources.description: There are a number of instances in which you want to upload documents to Turvo, and associate them with other Turvo objects. For example, you may want to upload a Proof of delivery document and associate that to a shipment, or upload an Insurance document and associate that to a carrier. When you use Documents API to upload those documents, you need to provide the Turvo object associated with that document by using context.

resources.name: Orders
resources.description: Orders represents a delivery process used to move a product from its point of sale to the hands of the customer. It contains details about the type and quantity of items being ordered. It will also outline the cost that have been agreed upon.

resources.name: Offers
resources.description: Offers allow Carrier or Customer to offer shipment with the specified amount.

resources.name: Update the status of a shipment
Shipments
resources.description: Shipments object represents a unit of capacity that is being moved, and stores relevant information needed to move that unit of capacity. A shipment may have multiple customers, have specific start / end date, and serves specific route.

resources.name: Inventory 2.0
resources.description:
Inventory 2.0 is an extended version of Inventory with some additional features outlined below that represent extensible inventory data model, which can accommodate inventory ingested at the lowest (for example serial) level. It is backwards compatible with inventory. Using the Inventory 2.0, you can:
  • Send consolidated inventory data to Turvo through the API at the base record level to add, update, or delete inventory from a given record.
  • Update inventory quantities for a specific inventory record with a provided reason code to view what updates to inventory occur with corresponding reason code
  • Add, update, or delete multiple inventory records at any given time.
  • Receive inventory updates at any time as shipping can occur all through the night keeping your inventory records consistently in sync as items are picked, shipped, and received in the warehouse
  • Receive the unique IDs upon performing an add, update, or delete operation after a successful transaction keeping the outside systems cross-referenced if they need to perform further manipulation on the inventory record.
  • As an administrative user, you get timeline time stamps with details around inventory adjustments (and separate inventory quantity update messages) recorded so you can track down the time and date when a particular inventory adjustment occurs.

resources.name: Inventory
resources.description: control the inflow and outflow of inventory by facility and at a lot level.

resources.name: Items
resources.description: Item object represents a product and relevant information of the product. An item can be added to shipment and/or order based on the inventory.

resources.name: Contacts
resources.description: In Contacts object, you can store information about external people that your company interacts with. You can add information such as email and phone, and you can associate contacts to existing accounts or locations. Additionally, you can retrieve information about a contact using their ID, edit them, or delete them from Turvo.

resources.name: Assets
resources.description: In Assets object, you can store vehicle information, sensor and carrier details. You can track the assets using Turvo or Geotab devices.

resources.name: Carriers
resources.description: Carriers are accounts that perform the shipments for your company. In the Carriers object, you can track information relevant to specific carriers, such as SCAC, address, and DOT number.

resources.name: Factors
resources.description: Factors are accounts that purchase accounts receivables from carriers and helps them with cash flow. Factors object can store relevant information, such as contact info, and can be managed through the API.

resources.name: Customers
resources.description: Customers object represents accounts you are providing service for, and allows you to store information about those accounts. Once created, you can use the customer reference across other Turvo entities, such as shipments.

resources.name: Locations
resources.description: In Turvo, Location objects hold information relevant to the locations that your business interacts with. You can create new location, edit attributes of an existing location (such as hours of operation, contact information, and special instructions), and delete unused locations.

resources.name: Groups
resources.description: Groups object enables you to create a collection of Users that belong to the same functional area. You can manage groups through the API, such as creating new groups, adding users to existing groups, or removing an existing group.

resources.name: Parent Or Other Accounts
resources.description: Parent API allows you to do the logical grouping of entities. Also it provides with the seraching ability of entities like Shipment,Orders,Location etc. based on associated Parent account. Other Account object represents accounts you are providing service for, and allows you to store information about those accounts

resources.name: Delete a Parent OR Other account
Retrieve a Parent OR Other account
Update a Parent OR Other account
Create a Parent OR Other account
Users
resources.description: Users API allows you to provide Turvo access to a new user, and specify relevant information about the user, such as name, permission, and contact information. In addition, it allows you to update information related to an existing user or permanently remove a user from Turvo.

resources.name: Authentication
resources.description:
The Turvo Public API supports authentication of your application API requests with its resources via the OAuth 2.0 (bearer token) authentication method.

Authentication API Details

The Authentication API is used to authenticate API requests and is required to authenticate Turvo Public API resources. Turvo provides a combination of Client ID (API Key) and Client Secret (Secret Key) to authenticate API requests for your project. Each project under your organization is associated with a combination of Client ID and Client Secret, called as API credentials.

How to get your Public API Credentials

  • Client ID – Your client_id will be publicapi.
  • Client Secret – Your client_secret will be secret.
For example, client_id = publicapi and client_secret = secret. API credentials serve the following purposes of:
  • Identifying the project making a call to the APIs.
  • Authenticating access to the APIs that are enabled under your project.

How the Authentication API Works

API Authentication

Once you have obtained the API credentials, the OAuth endpoint is used to get an access token which is used as credentials with each API transaction. To access Turvo resources, use the following endpoints to authenticate your application in the sandbox and production environments respectively:
  • https://my-sandbox.turvo.com/api/oauth/token
  • https://app.turvo.com/api/oauth/token
Provide the following required query parameters: 
  client_id = publicapi

  client_secret = secret
The following required inputs associated with the OAuth request are: 
  "grant_type": "password",

  "username": "",

  "password": "**********",

  "scope": "read+trust+write",

  "type": "business"
Note: The field ‘scope’ will have permissions “read+trust+write”. The field ‘type’ can be anything but the default type is ‘business’. The response to this request includes the following:
  • access_token – The encrypted OAuth token that needs to be used in the API transaction.
  • token_type – Type of token. In this case, it is bearer authentication.
  • expires_in – Token expiration time in milliseconds. One hour is the standard Token expiration time.
  • Scope – Scope of authentication provided to the customer. In this case, it is “read+trust+write”.
